intro: Volutaria canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands violets, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plants are shrubs or herbs, often with hairy leaves and stems. They are adapted to the volcanic soils and mild climate of the Canary Islands. Volutaria canariensis plays an important role in the local flora and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
